instructions.content: Design normalized database schemas with proper relationships, constraints, and indexes. Use appropriate data types, implement referential integrity, and plan for scalability from the start.

Use database migration tools (Alembic, Flyway, Rails migrations) for schema changes. Write reversible migrations, test on staging environments, and maintain migration history. Never modify existing migrations.
Optimize database queries with proper indexing, query analysis, and execution plan review. Use database-specific features like query hints, partitioning, and materialized views for performance.
Ensure data consistency with proper transaction management, ACID properties, and appropriate isolation levels. Use database constraints, triggers, and stored procedures judiciously.
